posts.post_content: Very bad convoke card, since you dont want you creatures to get tapped while they get +3/+3. And no trample...
posts.html:
Very bad convoke card, since you dont want you creatures to get tapped while they get +3/+3. And no trample...
Report Abuse  
Posted By: Gud3r1an (4/8/2010 1:40:18 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@Azr43l  
Strictly means there's no circumstance that could happen in which it's not better. With convoke and cheap token creation cards you can easily cast this earlier or with more creatures. While theres more to like on overrun this is by all means a go-to card for a token deck by comparison.   
  
Also, it works excellently with mobilize or vitalize. With 2 green mana and 6 saprolings you could cast Overwhelm and then attack with all 6 saps. You could do something else with the 3 mana you saved over overrun, like use life//death. A combo like that wins the game at a mere 3 mana.   
  
1 green, 6 saps- cast overwhelm  
use life (life//death)  
mobilze (untapping the saps and your lands)  
  
Attack with a minimum 9 4/4 creatures for 3 mana

Also, it works excellently with mobilize or vitalize. With 2 green mana and 6 saprolings you could cast Overwhelm and then attack with all 6 saps. You could do something else with the 3 mana you saved over overrun, like use life//death. A combo like that wins the game at a mere 3 mana.

posts.post_content: Ugh, completely antisynergistic with itself, unless you somehow spawned an infinite amount of tokens (and, this being Selesnya, I guess that was their point). Even then, you're better off with the many other stampede effects that ![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol) excels in: [Overrun](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Overrun), [Overwhelming Stampede](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Overwhelming Stampede), [Triumph of the Hordes](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Triumph of the Hordes), [Craterhoof Behemoth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Craterhoof Behemoth), just to name a few.
posts.html:
Ugh, completely antisynergistic with itself, unless you somehow spawned an infinite amount of tokens (and, this being Selesnya, I guess that was their point). Posted By: Azr43l (8/1/2009 5:21:16 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Good whenever you can afford to tap creatures and still stomp but don't have 5 mana: i.e., ultra fast token decks. In which case trample is no big deal anyway. It's not for making your handful of big beasties even bigger, then you try something else, probably [overwhelming stampede](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=overwhelming stampede) not overrun. The gap in between where you use overrun is becoming pretty small. I made 2 decks where I settled on overwhelm and overwhelming stampede as the best choices but nothing with overrun yet. Nothing like tapping out for [rhys the redeemed](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=rhys the redeemed) or playing an [avenger of zendikar](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=avenger of zendikar) or [mercy killing](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=mercy killing) or whatever huge token generator you have and then tapping your new creatures in the very same turn for an overwhelm.
posts.html:
Good whenever you can afford to tap creatures and still stomp but don't have 5 mana: i.e., ultra fast token decks. In which case trample is no big deal anyway. It's not for making your handful of big beasties even bigger, then you try something else, probably overwhelming stampede not overrun. The gap in between where you use overrun is becoming pretty small. I made 2 decks where I settled on overwhelm and overwhelming stampede as the best choices but nothing with overrun yet. Nothing like tapping out for rhys the redeemed or playing an avenger of zendikar or mercy killing or whatever huge token generator you have and then tapping your new creatures in the very same turn for an overwhelm.

Posted By: Nathreet (6/20/2011 2:30:42 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Let's do some freaken math here.  
Let's say at the very least you have 4 untapped forests. To play this you would need 3 creatures. But once you do your creatures are all tapped. Oh great... so i need 4 creatures to make this work... but that would only mean it's an overcosted giant growth... fail...  
Now let's say you have 5 untapped mana. You only need 2 creatures but to balance things out just like the previous example, you have 4 creatures. BUT WAIT. Isn't overrun 5 mana too? Plus i can attack with those 4 creatures too! another fail...  
Any more examples with more than 4 mana is a fail because you're either losing 1-2 creatures to attack or are overpaying a lesser effect card (the +3/+3 BUT no trample) while you've could've just played overrun and have 1 to 2 extra creatures to attack with PLUS trample.  
  
So overall this card is best used with a deck that uses 4 mana or less and can get lots of tokens by the time you get 4 mana. Otherwise it's a piece of [Overwhelm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Overwhelm)... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:

Now let's say you have 5 untapped mana. You only need 2 creatures but to balance things out just like the previous example, you have 4 creatures. BUT WAIT. Isn't overrun 5 mana too? Plus i can attack with those 4 creatures too! another fail...
Any more examples with more than 4 mana is a fail because you're either losing 1-2 creatures to attack or are overpaying a lesser effect card (the +3/+3 BUT no trample) while you've could've just played overrun and have 1 to 2 extra creatures to attack with PLUS trample.

So overall this card is best used with a deck that uses 4 mana or less and can get lots of tokens by the time you get 4 mana. Otherwise it's a piece of Overwhelm... (see all)
